mayflower

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • mayflower.Actor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Text

    public abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object

      int getDrawOrder()
      Returns the order this Actor will be drawn to the screen.
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height of this Actor's picture
      Keyboard getKeyboard()
      Return the Keyboard object This method must be called again every time the update() method is called to get the most recent state of the keyboard.
      Mayflower getMayflower()
      Return the Mayflower object
      Mouse getMouse()
      Return the Mouse object This method must be called again every time the update() method is called to get the most recent state of the mouse.

      Return the Picture assigned to this Actor
      Stage getStage()
      Return the Stage that this Actor was added to
      Actor[] getTouching()
      Return an array of Actors that are touching this Actor
      Actor[] getTouching(int offx, int offy)
      Return an array of Actors that are touching this Actor if the Actor were shifted by the specified offset
      Actor[] getTouching(java.lang.String direction)
      Return an array of Actors that are touching this Actor if the Actor were shifted 1 pixel in the specified direction: North, South, East, or West
      Actor getTouchingAtOffset(int dx, int dy)
      Return an Actor that is touching the point (x + dx, y + dy) where (x, y) is the location of this Actor

      Returns the order this Actor's update method will be called.

      Check if this Actor is touching the edge of the screen if it were shifted by 1 pixel in the specified direction

      abstract void update()

      • Actor

        public Actor()
        Constructs an Actor

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        This method is called every frame this Actor is in the active Stage

      • getUpdateOrder

        public int getUpdateOrder()
        Returns the order this Actor's update method will be called.

        Lower numbers are called first.

        Default: 10

        Returns:
        order this Actor's update method will be called

      • getDrawOrder

        public int getDrawOrder()
        Returns the order this Actor will be drawn to the screen.

        Lower numbers will be drawn first and covered up by higher numbers. gd

        Returns:
        order this Actor will be drawn to the screen

      • setUpdateOrder

        public void setUpdateOrder(int order)
        Sets the order that this Actor will be updated.

        Lower numbers will be updated first

        Default: 10

        Parameters:
        order - this Actor will be updated

      • setDrawOrder

        public void setDrawOrder(int order)
        Sets the order that this Actor will be drawn to the screen.

        Lower numbers will be drawn first and covered by by higher numbers.

        Parameters:
        order -

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int x,
                        int y)
        Sets the position that this Actor will be drawn to the screen.

        The top left is (0, 0)

        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate
        y - the y-coordinate

      • getTouching

        public Actor[] getTouching(java.lang.String direction)
        Return an array of Actors that are touching this Actor if the Actor were shifted 1 pixel in the specified direction: North, South, East, or West
        Parameters:
        direction - String representing direction to check for touching.
        Returns:
        an array of Actors that are touching this Actor

      • getTouching

        public Actor[] getTouching(int offx,
                           int offy)
        Return an array of Actors that are touching this Actor if the Actor were shifted by the specified offset
        Parameters:
        offx - the offset of the x-coordinate
        offy - the offset of hte y-coordinate
        Returns:
        an array of Actors that are touching this Actor

      • getTouchingAtOffset

                                 int dy)
        Return an Actor that is touching the point (x + dx, y + dy) where (x, y) is the location of this Actor
        Parameters:
        dx - the x offset to check
        dy - the y offset to check
        Returns:
        the Actor located at (x + dx, y + dy)

      • isTouching

        public boolean isTouching(java.lang.String direction,
                          Actor a)
        Checks if this Actor is touching Actor a if it were shifted by 1 pixel in the specified direction
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction to shift this Actor
        a - check if Actor a is being touched by this actor
        Returns:
        whether this Actor is touching Actor a after being shifted by 1 pixel in specified direction
